parse.title: Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China

text.*:
Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China
中华人民共和国教育部
Zhōnghuá Rénmín Gònghéguó Jiàoyùbù
Emblem of the People's Republic of China
Agency overview
Formed September 1954
Jurisdiction  People's Republic of China
Headquarters Beijing
Agency executive
  • Chen Baosheng, Minister of Education
Parent agency State Council
Child agencies
  • National Office For Teaching Chinese as a Foreign Language (NOCFL)
  • China Scholarship Council
Website www.moe.edu.cn (in English)

The Ministry of Education (MOE) of the People's Republic of China is the agency of the State Council of the People's Republic of China that regulates all aspects of the educational system in mainland China, including compulsory basic education, vocational education, and tertiary education. The MOE certifies teachers, standardizes curriculum and textbooks, establishes standards, and monitors the entire education system in an effort to "modernize China through education". It is headquartered in Xidan, Xicheng District, Beijing.[1] The MOE stresses technical education over other subjects.

The MOE was established in 1949 as the Ministry of Education of the Central People's Government, and was renamed the State Education Commission of the People's Republic of China from 1985 to 1998. Its current title was assigned during the restructuring of the State Council in 1998.

Contents

  • 1 List of Education Ministers
  • 2 See also
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

15 Yuan Guiren November 2009 July 2016
16 Chen Baosheng July 2016 Incumbent
